class_notes:
JM  Students only.  Per ABA rules, JD and LLM students will NOT receive credit for JM courses
This course is offered ONLINE
course_description:
A study of the basic principles governing the formation, performance, enforcement, and imposition of contractual obligations, and the role of these principles in the ordering processes of society.
This course cannot be taken if Contracts LAW 520 has already been taken and vice-versa.
prerequisites: THIS COURSE IS RESTRICTED TO STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE JURIS MASTER PROGRAM.
sections: Class Nbr: 5010, Section #: 001, Type: LEC, Campus: ONLIN, Meets: Meets Online, Instructor: M. Goldstein, Status: Open
